titlestmt.titleproper: Cambridge, Mass. Pilgrim Congregational Church of Cambridgeport records, 1863-1992.
titlestmt.author: William McCarthy

maintenanceevent.eventdescription: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Monday June 28, 2021 at 14:47

did.unittitle: Cambridge, Mass. Pilgrim Congregational Church of Cambridgeport records, 1863-1992.
did.abstract: Stearns Chapel was erected in 1863 and was located on Harvard Street, near Windsor; it was designed primarily as a Mission Sabbath School and operated for a number of years by the First and Second Congregational, Baptist and Methodist churches. The name was changed to Pilgrim Congregational Church of Cambridgeport in 1871. The collection includes church records, financial records, ministers' records, membership records, auxiliary group records, historical information, orders of service and programs, and photographs and lantern slides.

corpname.part: Pilgrim Congregational Church of Cambridgeport (Cambridge, Mass.)

accessrestrict.head: Restrictions on Access
accessrestrict.p: Access to this collection is unrestricted and open to the public.

userestrict.head: Restrictions on Use
userestrict.p: Items in this collection are subject to U.S. Copyright Law. It is the responsibility of the researcher to determine the copyright status of collection items and to secure any permissions necessary for their reproduction and publication. Requests for permission to publish material must be discussed with the archivist or librarian.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], in the Cambridge, Mass, Pilgrim Congregational Church of Cambridgeport records, 1863-1992, RG2350. The Congregational Library & Archives, Boston, MA.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Materials gathered by Rev. Norman Bendroth and donated to the Congregational Library & Archives, September 1992, by Warren L. Milley (Chairman, Board of Trustees) for Pilgrim Congregational Church.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Processed by Helen Schubert, April 2011. Reprocessed by William McCarthy, March 2017, using DACS Second Edition.

bioghist.head: Historical Note
bioghist.p: Stearns Chapel was erected in 1863 and was located on Harvard Street, near Windsor; it was designed primarily as a Mission Sabbath School (established by Prospect Congregational and neighborhood churches in Cambridgeport in 1852) and operated for a number of years by the First and Second Congregational, Baptist and Methodist churches. In 1865 Mr. Edward Abbott began to hold regular services; by fall the church was formally organized and Abbott installed as minister. The Second Congregational, Baptist and Methodist churches withdrew ca. 1866; in 1871 the First Church also withdrew. The church grew rapidly and a new meetinghouse was completed in 1871 at the corner of Magazine and Cottage Street; the name was changed to Pilgrim Congregational Church of Cambridgeport in the same year. The church closed in 1992.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The Pilgrim Congregational Church records document the history and life of the church, beginning with its predecessor church (Stearns Chapel, 1865-1871) and continuing through its closure in 1992. The collection includes church records, financial records, ministers' records, membership records, auxiliary group records (particularly the Women's Guild), historical information, orders of service and programs, and photographs and lantern slides. Records are more comprehensive for the early years of the church (through the early 1930) and the later decades (late 1960s to 1992) than for the middle of the twentieth century (a notable exception is the 75th Anniversary Celebration in 1940, which is well-documented). Researchers should be sure to look at the historical sketches included with the anniversary celebration materials in Series 7.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The Pilgrim Congregational Church records have been arranged into the five series listed below. Series 1 has been further subdivided into five subseries. Within each series materials have been primarily arranged in chronological order by start date. When appropriate, similar and continuous materials have been grouped together.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Materials
relatedmaterial.p: The finished course a sermon commemorative of Thomas Ferrier Jr., who died July 20th 1865 preached at the Stearns Chapel: Cambridgeport, Sabbath, July 30th by Rev. Edward Abbot (1865). Call No.: 15.0.7 6635 FEA-FIT
A Brief History of Pilgrim Church by Rev George R. Leavitt (1889). Call No.: 30.8.1 1004
Cambridge, MA: Pilgrim Congregational Church of Cambridgeport (1869-1940). Call No.: 17.11.1 C14.24 PILCC

corpname.part: Pilgrim Congregational Church of Cambridgeport (Cambridge, Mass.)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series, which has been further subdivided into five sub-series, contains the important administrative records of the Pilgrim Congregational Church. This broad designation covers materials related to the daily running of the church, records relating to the church's members, records of administrative committees, and records describing the activities and programs of the church.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This sub-series contains records directly related to the administration of the Stearns Chapel. Records include the Stearns Chapel Manual, membership list, Sabbath School programs, Orders of service, newsletter, correspondence, American Board of Commission for Foreign Missions receipts, and Committee reports for the examination, visiting, and neighborhood prayer meeting committees.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This sub-series contains records related to the members of the Pilgrim Congregational Church. This sub-series includes lists of members from various points in time, sporadic vital records, and admissions and dismissions.

separatedmaterial.head: Separated Materials
separatedmaterial.p: One box of membership letters was removed due to mold.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This sub-series contains the records of lay church committies directly related to the administration and day-to-day running of the Pilgrim Congregational Church. Included in the records are meeting minutes, correspondence, reports, and committee lists.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This sub-series contains records directly produced by the Pilgrim Congregational Church related to the running of the church. The records includes the Act of incorporation, church manuals, annual meeting minutes, annual reports, Deacons' and Trustees' records, Church Committee and Standing Committee records, other committee records, and correspondence. Records books for 1872-1914 and "notes on business meetings" for 1915-1930 have these different types of records together in chronological order, along with some membership records. Committee records (not including the Church Committee) are included for the 1970s-1991 only, and do not provide complete coverage. Correspondence is intermittent.

separatedmaterial.head: Separated Materials
separatedmaterial.p: Two Books of Church Committee records, covering 1894-1902, were removed from the collection due to mold.

did.unittitle: Manual of the Pilgrim Congregational Church

originalsloc.head: Existence of Originals
originalsloc.p: This folder contains photocopied facsimiles of the original annual reports. The Congregational Library & Archives does not hold the originals and they are presumed to have been lost or destroyed before the collection's acquisition.

did.unittitle: Board of trustees' minutes and correspondence

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This seub-series contains records related to the activities and programs of the Pilgrim Congregational Church. The records include historical sketches, newspaper clippings, and programs and materials from anniversary celebrations, including a large amount of material concerning the 75th Anniversary celebration. Of particular note is the "Memories of Pilgrim Congregational Church" scrapbook, compiled by the pastor and congregation at the time of its closing in 1992. The records also include records of church activities and programs, especially from end of the 19th Century through the first half of the 20th Century and during the 1980s, the church's last decade (including both church-sponsored events and community programs with which the church was involved). These records also include issues of Pilgrim/Cambridgeport Together, a newsletter put out by the church in the late 1980s.

separatedmaterial.head: Separated Materials
separatedmaterial.p: A copy of "A Brief History of Pilgrim Church" by Rev. George Leavitt (1889) was removed due to mold; a copy of this publication is located in the Congregational Library's holdings.

did.unittitle: Summer union services with First United Presbyterian Church

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series of financial and building records predominantly consist of ledgers and treasurers' reports. Treasurers' reports up through 1942 are annual reports, while Treasurers' reports from 1971-1992 are predominantly monthly reports, with some annual reports included. Also of note are fundraising letters from the pastor and financial committee, wills, trust account, and records related to the rental and sale of church properties.

did.unittitle: Proposal for new initiatives in church development funding

accessrestrict.head: Restrictions on Access
accessrestrict.p: These materials are confidential and not available to the public.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains the records of various church societies and auxillary groups. The most complete set of records is for the Women's Guild Service Club and its antecedents, the Women's Guild and the Ladies' Aid Society. The financial records for these groups from 1895-1962 include membership lists; the records books from 1934-1973 include minutes and annual reports. The series also include records for a small number of other social groups, the Sunday School and other Christian education groups, and the Missions Committee Records for the 1965-1990.

did.unittitle: Little Pilgrim Catechism and Missions Class
Sunday School Annual and Treasurers' Reports
Sunday School Annual and Treasurers' Reports
Young People's Society of Christian Endeavor
Ladies' Aid Society: Pilgrim Serving Society Cash Book
Women's Missionary Society Secretary's Record Book
Mr. & Mrs. Club Officers and Financial

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains records related to, and created by, the various ministers of the Pilgrim Congregational Church. The recordsconsists primarily of materials related to the installation and/or resignation of ministers from 1889-1928; not all ministers from this time period are represented. Records for Rev. Hubert Beckwith are more extensive and cover his entire tenure.

did.unittitle: Rev. Charles Olmstead call and installation

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series includes visual records, primarily photographs, and included are photographs of the church building and church members. The bulk of the photos are from the 1940s-1960s and from 1990. Some, but not all, of the photographs are labeled, identifying their subjects. There is also one folder containing two buttons from children's programs. The last box contains 75 lantern slides (housed in 6 smaller boxes), primarily of portraits of uniformed military members.
